boardgame.name: Clash of Cultures
boardgame.description: From Christian Marcussen, the creator of Merchants and Marauders, comes Clash of Cultures, a civilization game in which each player leads a civilization from a single settlement to a mighty empire. Players must explore their surroundings, build large cities, research advances and conquer those who stand in the way. The game features a modular board for players to explore, 48 distinct advances, seven mighty wonders, and loads of miniatures and cards. The winner will create a culture that will be remembered and admired for millennia._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Advances_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game features about 48 distinct advances. The whole _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;tech-tree_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; is very flexible with no dead ends, yet still intuitive, sensible and _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;realistic._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; Additionally you have a great overview of what advances other cultures have - no need to ask - just look._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Modular Board_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Players start with a civilization in its infancy. Move settlers to uncharted regions and reveal the terrain and its resources. Several mechanisms have been implemented to assure that an unlucky placement of region-tiles won't be a decider._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Playing Time_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game covers a time span similar to AH Civilization - that is to pre-gunpowder. This epic game is playable in about an hour per player! This is a pretty good playing time for a game that covers so much ground as this game will._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;City management_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Players expand their cities through the game. But not just to the generic larger city. Players instead choose a building type which represents the growth of the city. For instance you can expand a city with a port, fort, temple and academy - all with different benefits! Additionally cities can be _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;angry,_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;neutral_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; and _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;happy._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; Everything integrated in an intuitive and elegant fashion._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Multiple paths to victory_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Earn points through:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;- Founding cities and increasing their sizes_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;- Advances_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;- Objectives _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;- Wonders_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;- Events_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Game is in excellent shape, only played twice- all pieces are present and counted. Box outer edge crease has very minor wear. Flaws: One objective card has a medium crease- bump in it. One player mat has a very very small bend in the corner. Oddities: The strangest thing is several of the blue unit pieces are somewhat discolored (came that way out of the box)... I dont find it too jarring- definitely wouldnt disrupt the game, it is a slight greenish tint on blue pieces (maybe the color didnt blend properly in the mold?). Other than that everything is in very good - near mint condition.
